title: Allows public school principals and chief administrators to enroll academically low-performing students in after-school educational programs
summary: Allows public school principals and chief administrators to enroll academically low-performing students in after-school educational programs offering training or tutoring.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2354

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. CLARK, ORTIZ -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.
         COOK, GALEF -- read once and referred to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in  relation  to  authorizing  public
         school  principals  and  chief  administrators  to enroll academically
         low-performing students in after-school education programs

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new section 815 to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S  815.  AUTHORIZATION TO ENROLL UNDER-PERFORMING STUDENTS IN ACADEMIC
    4  AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS. THE PRINCIPAL OR CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR OF EACH  NEW
    5  YORK  STATE PUBLIC SCHOOL SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO ENROLL ANY STUDENT
    6  ATTENDING SUCH SCHOOL AND PERFORMING BELOW  ACADEMIC  STANDARDS  IN  ANY
    7  SUBJECT  REQUIRED  FOR  GRADUATION  IN  AN AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAM OFFERING
    8  TRAINING OR TUTORING IN SUCH SUBJECT. SUCH AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAM  MAY  BE
    9  CONDUCTED  ON SCHOOL PREMISES OR AT A NEIGHBORING SCHOOL OR OTHER NEIGH-
   10  BORING  EDUCATIONAL  FACILITIES  THAT  CONDUCT   ACADEMIC   AFTER-SCHOOL
   11  PROGRAMS APPROVED BY THE COMMISSIONER.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06536-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to authorizing public school principals and chief administrators to enroll academically low-performing students in after-school education programs
